snippet: The engineer who operated the Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx suffered what his lawyer referred to as “highway hypnosis” before the accident.
lead_paragraph: The engineer who operated the Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx suffered what his lawyer referred to as “highway hypnosis” before the accident.
abstract: Lawyer for William Rockefeller, engineer who operated Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx, killing four people and injuring more than 70, says he suffered what is referred to as 'highway hypnosis' before accident and that Rockefeller is 'extremely remorseful.'

headline.main: Train Engineer Was Dazed Before Crash, Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: Train Engineer Was Dazed Before Crash, Lawyer Says

byline.contributor: Andrew W. Lehren and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
